jobDescription: The Account Maintenance Specialist will load new professional customer accounts and perform maintenance and updates to existing active and special term accounts. Essential Job Functions Data entry, including loading new credit accounts and pulling account data. Maintain existing account data for professional customer including updates such as contact information, account types, paperless options and terms. Organize and gather data for new store openings and acquisitions, including reviewing sales data, account information for completeness, researching existing or duplicate accounts and pulling credit reports as needed. Create and maintain special term accounts. Assist field management teams with reviewing account inquiries and updating information as needed. Skills And Qualifications High school diploma or equivalent. Team player with excellent customer service and communication skills. Data entry with advanced typing skills. Proficient with Microsoft Word and Excel. Benefits All full time team members are eligible for a benefits package that is designed to offer convenience and security to our team members and their families. Programs, resources and benefit eligibility varies based on employment status, average hours worked, location and length of service. For detailed benefits info, please click here or type http://bit.ly/ORLYBenefits in your browser.

The Accounting/Finance Internship is a spring semester-long, paid internship that offers college students the opportunity to learn through application and fully immersing in the day-to-day activities of the Accounting/Financing team they are paired with. Throughout the internship, students will build upon their current skillsets, while learning from subject matter experts across the company. These internships have been established for college/university students with a business major and to run for the length of one typically school semester. Accounting majors are preferred. MUST SUBMIT A RESUME** Essential Job Functions Accounts Payable-Expense Team Prepare, upfront scan, pre-index and code utility draft bills. Support the team with mail handling, including opening, sorting, alphabetizing, and distribution of mail. Organizing, validating, and entering other invoices and expense reports, plus other miscellaneous projects Accounts Payable-Merchandise Team Data entry of invoices and matched credits with returns. Keying credit memos and obtaining proof of delivery documents. Assist with imaging and filing of documents, plus other miscellaneous projects, as needed. Accounts Receivable Team Support the team with check scanning, payment verification, and sending out invoice copy requests. Match unapplied payments to transactions on customer accounts and payment auditing. Assist with imaging and filing of documents, plus other miscellaneous projects, as needed. Treasury Team Gather localized bank data applicable to store locations. Support the team with various daily clerical and administrative related data entry. Assist with other miscellaneous requests, as needed. Skills And Qualifications Currently pursuing a bachelor's degree in a business related major at an accredited college or university. At a minimum, student must have declared a major and have at least freshman year completed at the beginning of the internship. Remain in good academic standing throughout internship. Proficient with MS Office Tools and strong knowledge of Windows PC. Excellent attention to detail and accuracy. Ability to work with limited supervision. Be able to work 22 hours per week in-person through the entirety of the spring internship. Benefits All full time team members are eligible for a benefits package that is designed to offer convenience and security to our team members and their families. Programs, resources and benefit eligibility varies based on employment status, average hours worked, location and length of service. For detailed benefits info, please click here or type http://bit.ly/ORLYBenefits in your browser.

The Accounts Payable Clerk is an entry level accounting position that will provide phone support for stores, perform data entry, account reconciliation, and issue resolution. This person will provide excellent customer service to stores, corporate departments, merchandise suppliers, and utility companies. Essential Job Functions Provide phone support for O'Reilly store managers. Assist with ordering and tracking purchase card. Assist suppliers and corporate departments with accounting issues. Data Entry of invoices. Work with utility companies regarding invoicing issues. Balance monthly statements to ensure accounts are in good standing. Populate simple spreadsheets to assist with account reconciliation. Skills And Qualifications Excellent work ethic. Excellent communication skills. Strong attention to detail. Excellent 10-key by touch. Basic Excel skills. As an Assistant Category Manager you will partner with Category Managers in selecting, marketing and managing product throughout the product lifecycle by building strong relationships with existing and potential suppliers as well as internal business partners. Take pride in working with a team that maintains continued growth of our Fortune 300 company through reporting and identifying opportunities to improve sales and customer product satisfaction by developing and leading key initiatives to drive profitability. What You'll Do Become the subject matter expert and point person in communications with stores, suppliers and internal departments Maximize profitability metrics and create competitive advantages within assigned categories Visit current and potential supplier facilities Present product and supplier recommendations to senior level management What You Bring To The Table Professional who is passionate and committed to growing your knowledge Self motivated team player and high achiever Analytical and research driven Win-Win negotiator Excellent communicator and collaborator Ability to lead and coordinate initiatives Who We Are Our company is built on the foundation of the O'Reilly culture. Our business ethics make up our company culture, and it is our way of life! jobTitle: Assistant Warehouse Department Supervisor - $4,000 Sign On Bonus
jobDescription: O'Reilly is looking for an enthusiastic and dedicated Assistant Warehouse Department Supervisor! You will be responsible for assisting our Warehouse Department Supervisors in the management of the day to day operations of your assigned areas in the warehouse. You will utilize your strong management and communication skills to help develop, train and mentor warehouse team members to ensure your team achieves department objectives and individual career goals. What We Offer Competitive wages 6 paid holidays Flexible Medical/Dental/Vision Plans, starting within 30 days 401K plan with employer contributions Opportunity for advancement and career development Bi-Weekly pay schedule What You Will Do Manage the day to day operations of your assigned department in the warehouse Identify and anticipate problems, challenges and opportunities by analyzing daily data and management reports Deliver excellent customer service by building & maintaining relationships Influence change management and operational performance What You Will Need 2+ years of supervisory or management experience in a distribution center High school diploma or equivalent Excellent written and verbal communication Ability to work flexible hours Ability to work closely with others in a team environment Candidates must be at least 18 years of age and able to pass a drug test and/or MVR check, as applicable for the role. Benefits All full time team members are eligible for a benefits package that is designed to offer convenience and security to our team members and their families. O'Reilly está contratando ventas de mostradores de venta al por menor bilingues. Los miembros de nuestro equipo de ventas son responsables de proporcionar a nuestros clientes minoristas e instaladores un alto nivel de servicio. También admiten la gestión en el cumplimiento de todas las tareas asignadas, incluido el mantenimiento del control de inventario, la apariencia de la tienda y las relaciones con los clientes. The Brand & Creative Services Manager will lead the overall visual and audio identity, design and copy creation team for the company. This includes evaluating and understanding stakeholder opportunities/problems and delivering creative solutions across multiple mediums including TV/video, radio, print, digital (email, social, display), exterior/interior store experience, proprietary brand development/packaging, presentations, internal communications and other as requested. Essential Job Functions Holistic understanding of the entire brand and creative development process. Oversee, manage, grow and protect the O'Reilly masterbrand and proprietary brands by developing, maintaining and requiring adherence to brand style, guidelines, tone and customer experience. Direct and mentor a team of supervisors (and freelancers, agencies and suppliers as needed) as they oversee the creative process from concept to completion, ensuring consistent adherence to the creative process and timeline. Primary scope includes traffic, brand & creative development and audio/video production. Prioritize work and manage workflow across the department. Present, explain and sell creative/campaign solutions to senior leaders and stakeholders Develop and grow the capabilities of team members and the department. Skills And Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in art, graphic design, marketing, communications or other relevant fields. 5-8 years of experience managing traffic, digital and conventional design, copywriting and audio/video production. Minimum 5-years of digital experience, including web, social display and emerging technologies. A solid understanding of brand development, design, copy and web best practices. Ability to present and communicate recommendations to stakeholders at all levels of the organization. Previous retail and/or advertising agency experience desired. Description A Business Systems Analyst I will efficiently and effectively capture functional and technical requirements necessary to accomplish modifications and development of new and existing mobile applications and supporting systems. They will work with lead business systems analysts, development teams, project managers and other internal and external parties as needed to help facilitate the successful completion of company projects and initiatives. Essential Job Functions Prepares for elicitation of requirements, able to identify the right questions to ask and identify where requirements are lacking and may require additional investigation to be performed. Actively listens during meetings and requirement gathering opportunities and create an environment where stakeholders will engage and contribute. Accurately captures feedback and facilitates discussions which result in the production of detailed requirements documentation. Creates current state functional diagrams with the knowledge captured during elicitation. Creates operational flow charts to help stakeholders and development teams understand the pieces of the system involved in the proposed change or modification. Produces meeting minutes to keep history of discussions and decisions made, as well as action items to keep the project moving forward. Creates solution design documentation to carry out the system modifications and elicits approvals from IT Management and stakeholders. Produces status updates to IT Management and stakeholders including timelines and upcoming activities. Work alongside Application Development Supervisor to create and manage development sprints in an Agile based development environment. Coordinate the development, testing, and deployment of mobile based projects. Perform user acceptance testing and end user training for assigned mobile projects. Assist with training and developing of Business Systems Analyst I. Act as subject matter expert for mobile based solutions. Other Job Functions Uses good judgment in what and how to communicate with stake holders. Accurately completes and submits meeting minutes in a timely manner. Values internal and external customers and responds to their needs as they arise. Prepares frequent project updates to the Project Team leaders. Proposes solutions to problems and considers timeliness, effectiveness, and practicality in addressing customer needs. Responsible for accurately and comprehensively eliciting and documenting functional and technical requirements Failure to perform required work results in rework and additional releases to correct problems. Skills and Qualifications Bachelors Degree or equivalent experience. 2 - 4+ years of business analyst experience or work in related field. Knowledge of SDLC and how it pertains to software releases. Experience in direct support of business organizations. Analytic and logical thinking. Strong interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills. Must work well in a team environment. Must be able to learn independently. Knowledge of flow charts including both business and system flows and of programming logic and code. MS Office and knowledge of diagraming tools including Visio, Gliffy, and Balsamiq. Desired: Familiarity with Adobe design suite and creative cloud including: Adobe XD, Illustrator, Photoshop, etc. Experience utilizing Google products including Firebase, Analytics, Play Console, Big Query, etc. PMI-Professional in Business Analysis (PBA) The Certified Professional for Requirement Engineering (IREB) ITIL Certification. Master's degree. Minor in Information Systems. cluding Jira, Confluence, and Bitbucket

Job Summary Provide administrative support to the Distribution Facilities Maintenance team, and the Distribution Operations Department as needed. The Customer Service Representative will interact with our online customers, field team members, and vendors to provide a welcoming and engaging experience. They will assist with part-lookup, pricing, site navigation, returns, product liability and labor claims, and conflict resolution. Available Schedules Option 1: You get to choose which 2 weekdays you want off, 2nd shift Option 2: Saturday - Wednesday, day shift Option 3: Monday - Friday, mid-shift Essential Job Functions Provide assistance to customers and field personnel regarding concerns or complaints. Receive, respond to, and resolve incoming customer inquiries and communication. Assist customers with product, operational, and policy questions. Work closely with field management teams to assist in reducing the Company's exposure to liability. Monitor product warranty/claim reports and investigate possible quality issues, reporting findings to leadership. Engage through Live Chat with customers, providing assistance with parts lookup, pricing and availability, order tracking, return and warranty assistance. Assist Loss Prevention with monitoring orders for fraud and take appropriate action to prevent loss. Skills and Qualifications High school diploma or equivalent. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to multi task and meet deadlines. Proficient typing, email, spreadsheet, and word processing skills. Skilled with online applications such as social media platforms and various other applications. Customer service call center experience desired. Basic knowledge of automotive systems desired. This is a full time opportunity; flexible schedule options available.

The DC HR Business Partner will provide human resources support for DC management and team members through recruiting and hiring applicants according to staffing needs, conducting new team member orientation, and conducting benefits classes. This position will maintain close contact with corporate human resources to ensure compliance with O'Reilly policies and procedures, and state/federal employment laws and regulations. They provide team member relations support, and work with management and team members to ensure the highest level of morale and productivity. Essential Job Functions Responsible for recruitment of distribution center positions Attend local job fairs and establish a relationship with local schools to recruit for openings Draft and place employment advertisements for the distribution center and process invoices for approval and payment Accept Referral Bonus Forms and forward to corporate human resources. Maintain current job postings for distribution center Prepare and post internal and corporate job opening announcements Coordinate application process and conduct preliminary interviews Conduct pre-employment testing, check references, and arrange pre-employment drug screens Develop and maintain relationship with temporary agencies and coordinate assignments for temporary employees Support DC manager and supervisors in team member relations efforts; work to ensure high team member morale, and coordinate the progressive discipline process and application of other human resources policies with local management and corporate Conduct new team member orientation, responsible for timely completion of new hire paperwork, and benefit enrollment information Place orders for uniforms, review billing from uniform company, and prepare for payment Process team member status changes for DC manager approval and submit to corporate human resources Coordinate driver drug testing, physicals, ensure DOT compliance, and maintain DOT driver files. Answer questions from team members concerning benefits, insurance, and any personnel questions that may arise Maintain performance evaluation schedule and coordinate distribution of performance evaluations to distribution center supervisors making certain that performance evaluations are completed in a timely manner Ensure compliance with all local, state, and federal laws and regulations Collaborate with risk management to manage all work-related team member injuries Responsible for prompt reporting of all accidents to either risk management or claim administrator as directed by risk management Work with risk management driving eligibility administrator to ensure driving eligibility requirements are satisfied, including pre-employment MVRs and drug testing Coordinate post-accident claim management with injured team member's supervisor, DC safety supervisor (if applicable), and risk management Skills And Qualifications High school diploma or equivalent Two years as human resources specialist Experience with PC's Excellent communication, leadership, and employee relations skills Record of organizational, recruiting, and counseling skills Candidates must be at least 18 years of age and able to pass a drug test and/or MVR check, as applicable for the role. Benefits All full time team members are eligible for a benefits package that is designed to offer convenience and security to our team members and their families. Programs, resources and benefit eligibility varies based on employment status, average hours worked, location and length of service. For detailed benefits info, please click here or type http://bit.ly/ORLYBenefits in your browser.

The O'Reilly Real Estate department is expending! We are looking to add several new Development Project Managers to our growing team! The Distribution Center Field Trainer is responsible for training and educating distribution center leadership and personnel to ensure efficient processes and best practices are being followed. They will prepare and present various reports measuring key performance indicators of training. Essential Job Functions Travel 3 to 4 weeks monthly for implementation and oversight of distribution center processes, procedures, and best practices. Prepare reports and presentations for leadership review, and track the progress, documentation, and success of newly implemented processes. Perform research and analysis to determine how to make enhancements to individual DC performance and the facilities ability to service store customers and train leadership on the enhancements. Assist warehouses with compliance in all O'Reilly, federal, state and local rules and regulations. Collaborate with other departments to determine if there are opportunities for additional training to ensure success in each warehouse. Skills and Qualifications High school diploma or equivalent. Minimum 2 years of applicable work experience. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Proficiency with Microsoft Office suite and database systems applications. Ability to work in fast paced environment with high level of accuracy and reliability. This is a full-time opportunity; Monday-Friday, 8 a.m.-5 p.m.

Through our commitment to our team members and to our customers, we have grown into a diverse team that lives the O'Reilly culture daily. Our group of strong leaders provide the training and support needed to take you beyond the warehouse and into your career. Above all is Excellent Customer Service, which is the core of O'Reilly and the most important responsibility of our team members. The Distribution Systems Coordinator is responsible for coordinating system configurations, implementation of system enhancements and process improvements to support the objectives of the Distribution Operations department resulting in a higher level of efficiency and excellent customer service. Essential Job Functions Serve in the capacities of outbound task force leader, project sponsor, or user champion in the implementation of distribution systems and process improvements. Responsible for configuration of the outbound components of the warehouse management system affecting picking, shipping, city counter, on-line DC orders, etc. Comprehensive end-user testing of system enhancements. Work closely with store operations and IT to ensure DC hub routing accuracy in support of priority parts. Perform research and analysis to support distribution objectives. Travel as needed to support distribution objectives, system implementations, and configurations. Skills And Qualifications High school diploma or equivalent. At least 2 years of experience in O'Reilly distribution center operations - order selection, shipping. Working knowledge of Microsoft Office, Excel, Access, and Query tools. Good communication skills. Benefits All full time team members are eligible for a benefits package that is designed to offer convenience and security to our team members and their families. The district manager in training (DMIT) will spend a minimum of six weeks training to ensure the Company provides adequate training and is prepared to assume a district manager's responsibilities. Throughout this training, the DMIT will oversee operations of assigned stores and act as the immediate supervisor of the store managers. Essential Job Functions Provide excellent customer service to customers, as well as team members Responsible for the hiring and dismissal process of all team members in district Conduct and perform evaluations for all team members in district Work closely with store management to ensure that each store is profitable Report reoccurring operational problems to company management for appropriate action Coordinate weekly outside sales call schedule of store manager and any salesmen in the district Ensure the store is operating at an efficient level and in accordance with company policies and procedures Assist manager in working with the Sales and Pricing Departments in establishing installer customer pricing along with appropriate walk-in pricing Assist store manager in scheduling to adequately staff the stores, while evaluating daily payroll percentages Provide leadership with monthly stock adjustments, recalls, overstock removal, and routine inventory maintenance Ensure that all stores in district are maintained and presentable according to company guidelines All other duties as assigned by leadership Qualifications Minimum one year experience in O'Reilly or field store operations at the manager level Excellent verbal and written communication skills ASE certification desired, but not required O'Reilly takes pride in our company culture, so team members should also hold our culture values as true to their own. O'Reilly values are centered on Commitment, Dedication, Teamwork, Safety/Wellness, Enthusiasm, Expense Control, Honesty, Professionalism, Respect, Hard Work, and a Win-Win Attitude. The Driving Eligibility Assistant answers call for the "How Am I Driving" program and assess the validity of the call. This team member will gather information that will be utilized to improve driver performance. The Driving Eligibility Assistant assists store management with systems and process questions related to driving records. Essential Job Functions Assist store and DC management with questions regarding motor vehicle records. Notify store and DC management of ineligible drivers, as well as identify drivers that additional information is needed. Ensure that all red light citations are handled, to include point assessment and monetary deduction from TMs. Skills And Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent. Experience using Microsoft Suit. Good communication skills and organizational skills. Strong multi-tasking skills and attention to detail. Description O'Reilly Auto Parts is looking to expand the eCatalog team! Our Electronic Catalog Supervisor's primary purpose is to supervise the Electronic Product Catalog content technicians by managing their work assignments and ensuring the content updates coincide with O'Reilly merchandising department's product line update process. The supervisor also coordinates the quality assurance process for all data and content updates. Essential Job Functions Supervises electronic content technicians in maintaining the accuracy of the Electronic Product Catalog system (EPC) Works closely with the Merchandise Content Acquisition Team to ensure timely and complete deliveries of content from each provider Oversees the quality control processes over content related to catalog system Provides training, direction, and developmental support to catalog data technicians Skills And Qualifications Supervisory experience managing multiple projects across differing deadlines Strong automotive product knowledge and understanding of automotive theories and repair Experienced using database products such as MS SQL, MySQL and MS Acess A strong understanding and practical experience using SQL query tools leveraging either MS SQL, MySQL or MS Access database engines Benefits All full time team members are eligible for a benefits package that is designed to offer convenience and security to our team members and their families. O'Reilly Auto Parts continues to look for talented professionals to join our growing Electronic Catalog Department in Phoenix, AZ. We are currently seeking a Automotive Data Analyst who will work closely with our team to process and maintain the content within our Electronic Product Catalog (EPC). The ideal candidate will have extensive auto parts knowledge and experience using Microsoft Office Suite applications and light database use. Essential Job Functions Maintain the accuracy of the Electronic Product Catalog (EPC) by analyzing new content for accuracy and completeness using quality assurance tools. Develop and enhance value-add content in support of products within eCatalog database. Interacts with trading partners to validate and acquire updated content in support of enhancing coverage and identified issues. Ensure content supporting pending line changes or product line reviews is properly represented within eCatalog system prior to store release. Skills And Qualifications Strong automotive product knowledge and understanding of automotive theories. Thorough knowledge of automotive parts cataloging or parts counter experience. Professional verbal and written communication skills. Previous experience in eCatalog content processing is desired. Understanding of the Auto Care Association standards for content delivery is preferred. jobTitle: Empleado de almacen - Manejo de materiales
jobDescription: Salarios competitivos con potencial de aumentos cada 6 meses Beneficios disponibles, incluyendo planes médicos, dentales, de visión, de compra de acciones, 401(k), etc. O'Reilly está contratando empleados de almacén, dedicados y trabajadores que se puedan desempeñar en un entorno activo y de ritmo rápido. Los empleados de almacén son una parte crucial de nuestro equipo y son clave en el éxito del almacén. Buscamos personal con gran habilidad de precisión y productividad que nos ayuden a tener los productos correctos, en el lugar correcto, al momento correcto. Ofrecemos entrevistas presenciales y decisiones de contratación el mismo día. ¡Esta oportunidad es para ti! Ven y forma parte de nuestra cultura. Qué Ofrecemos Salarios competitivos con potencial de aumentos cada 6 meses 6 días festivos pagados Planes flexibles médicos/dentales/de visión, a partir de 30 días Plan 401(k) con contribuciones del empleador Oportunidades de ascenso y crecimiento profesional Pago bisemanal Qué Harás Igualar números de forma rápida y precisa Almacenar los productos y llenar los contenedores para su envío Estar orgulloso de ofrecer un excelente servicio al cliente Desenvolverte en un entorno de almacén activo y de ritmo rápido Requisitos Habilidades básicas de computación Habilidad para trabajar en equipo Diploma de bachillerato (high school) o Educación General (GED), preferido pero no requerido Si el puesto lo requiere, habilidad para operar maquinaria (Montacargas/Cherry Picker), proveemos capacitación Flexibilidad para trabajar horas extras Los candidatos deben tener al menos 18 años de edad y pasar un examen de drogas y/o una verificación del récord de manejo (MVR), según lo requiera el puesto. Benefits All full time team members are eligible for a benefits package that is designed to offer convenience and security to our team members and their families. The Event and Sports Marketing Specialist is responsible for the planning, coordination, and execution of all Event and Sports Marketing programs. They will work extensively with promoters, field representatives and applicable departments. Essential Job Functions Plan, coordinate and execute all Event and Sports Marketing activities, programs and promotions. Create follow-up reporting for Event and Sports Marketing efforts, showing results against predefined KPI's. Work with event promoters and/or venues on logistics of sponsored events. Work with all departments on project timelines and deadlines. Maintain budget spreadsheet. Work with legal department on contracts and proper verbiage needed on agreements. Communicate details of Event and Sports Marketing activities to the field as necessary. Required Skills and Qualifications Minimum 2 years of experience in a similar role. Proven experience developing and executing promotional campaigns. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Excellent analytic skills. Solid organizational skills. Proactive, self-starter who is comfortable in a TEAM-oriented work environment. Proficiency with MS PowerPoint, Excel, and Word. Desired Bachelor's degree in marketing, communications or business. Knowledge of auto parts and auto repair/maintenance. Bi-lingual (Spanish/English). Knowledge of internal O'Reilly processes. Retail marketing experience and/or retail store operations experience. Looking to make a real impact on the day-to-day operations of a company? Well . . . jump in the driver's seat of your career at O'Reilly Auto Parts! We are looking for an Executive Support Coordinator to work with our executive leadership team to help shape the daily operations and supply chain management for our nearly 6,000 stores and 80,000 plus team members. This person will serve as the liaison between executive leadership and internal and external business partners. This person will successfully communicate with team members of all levels to execute and deliver on identified tasks or projects. Essential Job Functions Responsible for providing support to the executive leadership team, including support with scheduling meetings, generating correspondence, managing calendars, supporting operational strategies, and building relationships with both internal and external business partners. Provides leaders with support for reference calls and interviews with potential suppliers and business partners. Collaborates with executive team members across departments to determine and prioritize business strategies. Plans and coordinates department or committee meetings and is responsible for maintaining accurate record keeping/minutes of such meetings. Responsible for ongoing project management and oversight for various enterprise-wide special projects/initiatives. Skills And Qualifications 2-3 years of experience providing support to executive leadership. Exceptional verbal and written communication, project management, and analytical skills. Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail with an adherence to confidential matters. Proficient with Confluence and Microsoft Office programs including Excel, Word, Access, PowerPoint, and Outlook. Must be proactive, self-motivated, and highly collaborative. High school diploma or equivalent. Bachelor's degree or higher desired. Step on the gas and APPLY NOW! The Field Safety Manager will work with corporate safety team to ensure all distribution center, store, and fleet safety programs, along with regulatory compliance initiatives, are carried out. This role will participate in identifying trends and developing appropriate programs and tools to minimize loss and regulatory noncompliance exposure. Will have a heavy emphasis in on-site training through knowledge of safety principles, operations, regulatory requirements, and fleet safety. Essential Job Functions Serve as dedicated resource for DC and store fleet safety training and quality assurance. This will include a key role in training/compliance for DOT and HAZMAT training/documentation. Will work closely with Director of Safety, Environmental and Regulatory Compliance ensuring focused and ongoing training. Review, evaluate and analyze DC and store work environments. Analyze monthly team member Injury & Safe Driving Reports for trends. Create procedures and programs to eliminate, prevent or control injuries. Conduct audits and/or assessments to help enforce adherence to all DC and store policies, in addition to any applicable laws and regulations governing the health and safety of our team members and/or the general public. Incorporate all aspects of general fleet and driving eligibility programs, material handling, substance abuse testing, and regulatory compliance in ongoing training and quality assurance programs. Conduct distribution center, region, district, and store visits for training, quality assurance, and program quality validation. Skills And Qualifications Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Strong presentation skills. Ability to quickly develop rapport and help others understand objectives and purposes. Willingness to travel 75% throughout the year. Ability to pro-actively develop programs with limited supervision, while being cognizant of importance of keeping others informed of activity. Self-motivated and willing to put in extra time to achieve corporate and departmental objectives. The HR Supervisor will provide human resources support for DC management and team members through recruiting and hiring applicants according to staffing needs, conducting new team member orientation, and conducting benefits classes. jobTitle: Human Resources Business Partner - Kansas City, MO
jobDescription: The HR Business Partner is responsible for human resource activities within their assigned market. This team member will partner with HR and Store Operations to drive the execution of multiple business plans related to team member relations, engagement and development, retention, turnover improvement, and recruitment of quality talent. The HR Business Partner will lead by example to promote the O'Reilly culture and brand to existing and potential future team members. Essential Job Functions Investigate, analyze, and exercise sound judgement to make appropriate decisions to resolve complex employee relations issues in accordance to company policy, and federal, state and local laws Use knowledge of local markets to collaborate with Store Operators, and Division HR Manager to execute key strategies in promoting team member engagement and retention Actively work with Division HR Manager, and Store Operators to identify, and create solutions to resolve employee turnover challenges Identify, create, and implement best practices to acquire, and retain top talent Provide appropriate interpretation, and direction concerning company policy and local/state/federal HR employment laws Work with integrity, confidentiality, and demonstrate sound judgment when engaging with employees, Store Operators, and others when making decisions Work with the Divisional HR Manager with regards to annual turnover goal setting as well as TM retention action plans Use purposes Document investigations in our Employee Relations Case Management System to manage cases from initiation to resolution Actively monitor case load volumes to ensure effective and timely process to include: strategic hiring, sourcing active and passive candidates, and "driving" candidates to our application Other duties as assigned by Division HR Manger or corporate HR Skills And Qualifications Proven ability to make decisions and exercise sound judgement Ability to maintain a high level of confidentiality, diplomacy, and the highest level of discretion Knowledge of Human Job Title: Software Engineer Department: Information Systems General Summary: A Software Engineer is a highly skilled software developer with expert knowledge in at least one department or system. They work with a high degree of independence and develop information systems to support the business. Engineers are primarily focused on the design or integration of various software systems, databases, and third-party packages. ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS Generally takes leadership role in guiding projects through the complete software development life cycle Typical focus is on code design efforts Solid understanding of secure coding techniques and best practices Responsible (takes ownership) for multiple software applications Manage tasks and resources while utilizing modern project management principles Participate or lead the development of multiple projects at one time Conducts code reviews and ensures coding best practices are being followed Recommend software improvements and changes to systems, as needed May approve software to be deployed to production systems Perform software and data analysis to uncover issues and solve complicated problems that typically span multiple systems Lead various meetings to gather software requirements and project details Conduct software demo’s to educate and train others in the use of software Debug and correct complex software defects Develop new or modify existing software using coding best practices Create or update advanced project documentation Test software to validate accuracy of code and high quality software systems Required: 4+ years of software development experience Advanced understanding of change management and the O’Reilly change control process and procedures Advanced knowledge of Project Development Life Cycle (PDLC) and Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) Advanced understanding of the software and system(s) supported by their team, as well as the overall company business Ability to lead and get results from others Ability to articulate advanced technical concepts and teach others Ability to effectively multitask Expert software debugging and testing knowledge Advanced understanding of complex computer systems (multiple programs, databases, communications etc) Advanced knowledge of programming, database systems, and systems analysis and design Ability to write advanced technical documentation Advanced problem-solving skills Good verbal and written communications skills Must work well in a team environment Ability to learn independently Willingness to work flexible schedule including nights/weekends High School diploma or equivalent Desired: A bachelors of science in a technology related field Excellent verbal skills Education in leadership and or teambuilding Education in Project Management and Business Analysis Advanced technical training or certifications related to scope of work Ability to motivate and inspire others

The Multicultural Marketing Coordinator will coordinate the development, creation and implementation of all retail and professional customer multicultural marketing projects and efforts. Develop ongoing strategic goals to support company direction Identify, plan and execute programs which ensure our brand resonates with our growing multicultural customer base within our market areas; making recommendations accordingly to Marketing leadership Create foundational and strategic programs for multicultural consumer segments and integrate those across various creative outputs including linear, digital, social, retail and event marketing Provide input, cultural understanding and creative thinking to elevate the way we reach multicultural consumers Run the development and execution of national creative campaigns for multicultural consumers across channels such as TV, digital, OOH, social, web, retail, and events, alongside the Brand & Creative team Skills And Qualifications Bilingual- Spanish/English Proficiency in MS Office Suite Excellent verbal, communication, organizational, and time-management skills. General Summary: The Network Operations Center (NOC) Manager is a leadership position overseeing all duties and responsibilities of the NOC team to include operational and engineering activities. As a leader, this candidate will be responsible for developing a high-performing team to ensure the Company’s effectiveness in identifying and responding to real-time escalation issues. This position also works closely with other teams in Information Technology (IT) security, infrastructure, support, and operations areas to provide superior reporting, monitoring, triage, communication, and escalation for IT business services. Essential Job Functions: · Responsible for the staffing, dismissing, goal setting, coaching, and evaluating of the NOC team. Collaborate with other IT management to enhance visibility and cross-communication, establish escalation and notification standards for network incidents, and ensure adherence to IT cross-functional lines of effort and Service Level Agreements (SLAs) · Manage effective processes for communication on network health, impacts, executive escalations, and other critical analysis to leadership and key stakeholders · Responsible for assessing, developing, and maturing the capabilities of the NOC staff, which includes the maturation of people, processes, and technology. · Plan, develop, and execute the strategies, processes and technologies of current NOC resources while also executing the forecasting of current and future budgetary needs · Responsible for root cause and problem analysis with NOC staff and IT teams across all business critical systems/services · Manage and execute objectives, plans, and policies for area of responsibility in line with organizational level strategy to include establishing metrics to drive stability and performance improvements · Develop and execute training programs for new and existing NOC staff · Manage the Engineering efforts with the development and/or revision of NOC processes, protocols, and systems · Perform other related duties as required Skills & Education · Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Computer Information Systems or equivalent work experience · 6-8 years’ of experience in systems administration and/or information technology administration · 3-5 years’ of experience in a NOC environment or working with incident response, incident management, disaster recover, change management · Leadership experience managing cross-functional teams and influencing senior level management and key stakeholders · Ability to prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment and make sound decisions in emergency situations. · Excellent interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills · Excellent performance leadership experience, mentorship, and the ability to provide growth opportunities for staff members · Ability to write technical instructions in the administration of systems and/or systems modifications · Conflict resolution and/or mediation skills

The Operations Manager will partner with the warehouse manager to resolve all warehouse related issues by proactively providing feedback and facilitating training when needed. This team member will be responsible for determining the efficiency of operations, and for identifying areas of improvement. By accepting a position as a Warehouse Operations Manager, you will be gaining the knowledge and expertise of the industry. Through our commitment to our team members and to our customers, we have grown into a diverse team that lives the O'Reilly culture daily. Our group of strong leaders provide the training and support needed to take you beyond the warehouse and into your career. Essential Job Functions Provide support to the warehouse manager in all aspects of operations, including service, physical assets, operating costs, and team member relations Partner with warehouse leadership to maintain payroll, budgeting, inventory integrity, and productivity Provide the training, guidance, and counseling necessary for individual team members Provide excellent leadership throughout all departments and ensure productivity and morale are maintained at a high level Provide a safe working environment and manage all risks and risk related costs Qualifications Excellent communication, leadership, and people skills Above average computer skills High school graduate or equivalent Two + years of warehouse supervisor experience with a proven record of success Demonstrated ability to lead multiple departments within one warehouse/facility College degree or logistics certification desired but not required Benefits Offered Medical/Dental/Vision Plans, starting within 30 days 401K plan with employer contributions Paid vacation, holiday and sick time Flexible Spending Account Team Member Discount O'Reilly takes pride in our company culture, so team members should also hold our culture values as true to their own. O'Reilly values are centered on Commitment, Dedication, Teamwork, Safety/Wellness, Enthusiasm, Expense Control, Honesty, Professionalism, Respect, Hard Work, and a Win-Win Attitude. Above all is Excellent Customer Service, which is the core of O'Reilly and the most important responsibility of our team members. Candidates must be 18 years of age or older, able to pass a background check, drug test and/or MVR check, as applicable for the role Benefits All full time team members are eligible for a benefits package that is designed to offer convenience and security to our team members and their families. Programs, resources and benefit eligibility varies based on employment status, average hours worked, location and length of service. The Parts City District Sales Manager is responsible for actively promoting the Parts City Auto Parts Affiliate program to recruit and develop new business. They utilize our current programs and industry expertise to become a business partner to store ownership and management teams. This position will work directly with 20-25 independent jobber stores within Missouri. Essential Job Functions Expand the distribution of the Parts City affiliate program through new markets and competitive store changeovers. Research and determine the competitive factors and business conditions to assist store management and ownership in growing their business. Build strong relationships by promoting the products, programs, and services exclusively available to Parts City Affiliates. Present programs and policies in a clear and timely manner and assess the effectiveness of each program and promotion at the wholesale and retail levels. Review monthly computer reports for each Parts City store to ensure returns from each customer are within acceptable parameters and product line support does not decline. Provide guidance regarding product merchandising and advertising to attain full participation in our annual marketing program. Plan and participate in new store installations, remodel projects, and store inventories at associate and corporate locations. Skills And Qualifications High school diploma or equivalent. Two years of counter experience and or outside sales experience in the automotive aftermarket. Strong verbal and written communication skills. Good people skills. Must be organized and able to set priorities and manage time in territory. College degree in business and/or marketing desired. Sales training in automotive aftermarket preferred. Benefits All full time team members are eligible for a benefits package that is designed to offer convenience and security to our team members and their families. Programs, resources and benefit eligibility varies based on employment status, average hours worked, location and length of service. For detailed benefits info, please click here or type http://bit.ly/ORLYBenefits in your browser.

These team members will also provide a high level of customer service by communicating problems or special requests from customers to store management. Essential Job Functions Drive company vehicle to deliver parts and products to customer and pick up customer returns Maintain all necessary documents, such as daily trip sheets, driver log-book, driver return slips, mileage log, etc. Responsible for payments collected on daily deliveries Project a professional and personable image to maintain good customer relations Report vehicle maintenance needs immediately to store manager Drive safely and defensively, adhering to all company safety standards Qualifications Ability to provide outstanding, friendly, and professional customer service Ability to quickly match alphanumeric sequences Good interpersonal communication skills Ability to adapt quickly and effectively to changing delivery situations Familiarity with automotive parts is desired but not required Must have a valid driver's license with an acceptable motor vehicle record (MVR) per department standards O'Reilly takes pride in our company culture, so team members should also hold our culture values as true to their own. O'Reilly values are centered on Commitment, Dedication, Teamwork, Safety/Wellness, Enthusiasm, Expense Control, Honesty, Professionalism, Respect, Hard Work, and a Win-Win Attitude. Above all is Excellent Customer Service, which is the core of O'Reilly and the most important responsibility of our team members. Candidates must be able to pass a drug test and/or MVR check, as applicable for the role. Benefits All full time team members are eligible for a benefits package that is designed to offer convenience and security to our team members and their families. Programs, resources and benefit eligibility varies based on employment status, average hours worked, location and length of service. For detailed benefits info, please click here or type http://bit.ly/ORLYBenefits in your browser.

These team members will also provide a high level of customer service by communicating problems or special requests from customers to store management. Essential Job Functions Drive company vehicle to deliver parts and products to customer and pick up customer returns Maintain all necessary documents, such as daily trip sheets, driver log-book, driver return slips, mileage log, etc. Responsible for payments collected on daily deliveries Project a professional and personable image to maintain good customer relations Report vehicle maintenance needs immediately to store manager Drive safely and defensively, adhering to all company safety standards Qualifications Ability to provide outstanding, friendly, and professional customer service Ability to quickly match alphanumeric sequences Good interpersonal communication skills Ability to adapt quickly and effectively to changing delivery situations Familiarity with automotive parts is desired but not required Must have a valid driver's license with an acceptable motor vehicle record (MVR) per department standards O'Reilly takes pride in our company culture, so team members should also hold our culture values as true to their own. O'Reilly values are centered on Commitment, Dedication, Teamwork, Safety/Wellness, Enthusiasm, Expense Control, Honesty, Professionalism, Respect, Hard Work, and a Win-Win Attitude. Above all is Excellent Customer Service, which is the core of O'Reilly and the most important responsibility of our team members. Candidates must be able to pass a drug test and/or MVR check, as applicable for the role. Benefits All full time team members are eligible for a benefits package that is designed to offer convenience and security to our team members and their families. Programs, resources and benefit eligibility varies based on employment status, average hours worked, location and length of service. For detailed benefits info, please click here or type http://bit.ly/ORLYBenefits in your browser.

These team members will also provide a high level of customer service by communicating problems or special requests from customers to store management. Essential Job Functions Drive company vehicle to deliver parts and products to customer and pick up customer returns Maintain all necessary documents, such as daily trip sheets, driver log-book, driver return slips, mileage log, etc. Responsible for payments collected on daily deliveries Project a professional and personable image to maintain good customer relations Report vehicle maintenance needs immediately to store manager Drive safely and defensively, adhering to all company safety standards Qualifications Ability to provide outstanding, friendly, and professional customer service Ability to quickly match alphanumeric sequences Good interpersonal communication skills Ability to adapt quickly and effectively to changing delivery situations Familiarity with automotive parts is desired but not required Must have a valid driver's license with an acceptable motor vehicle record (MVR) per department standards O'Reilly takes pride in our company culture, so team members should also hold our culture values as true to their own. O'Reilly values are centered on Commitment, Dedication, Teamwork, Safety/Wellness, Enthusiasm, Expense Control, Honesty, Professionalism, Respect, Hard Work, and a Win-Win Attitude. Above all is Excellent Customer Service, which is the core of O'Reilly and the most important responsibility of our team members. Candidates must be able to pass a drug test and/or MVR check, as applicable for the role. Benefits All full time team members are eligible for a benefits package that is designed to offer convenience and security to our team members and their families. Programs, resources and benefit eligibility varies based on employment status, average hours worked, location and length of service. For detailed benefits info, please click here or type http://bit.ly/ORLYBenefits in your browser.

A Principal Business Systems Analyst will capture functional and technical requirements necessary to accomplish a modification to a software system or development of a new system, and create the solution design document to carry out requested modifications. They are responsible for recommending the order of system modifications based on business value that they are the subject matter expert on. They will work with business analysis management, development teams, project managers and other internal and external parties as needed to help facilitate the successful completion of company projects and initiatives. Fully Remote, Medical, Dental, Vision and 401K. Pay does vary DOE: $110K-$130K DOE (possible more DOE) Essential Job Functions: · Conducts elicitation of project requirements, ensures the correct stakeholders are involved, and creates an environment where stakeholders participate and contribute · Creates project documentation including requirements break downs, current state and operational flow chart diagrams, meeting minutes, solution designs, and project status updates · Facilitates the approvals from IT Management and stakeholders on project requirements and project decisions · Responsible for collecting, managing, and facilitating change requests · Actively documents project risks and creates plans to handle the risks as they arise · Produces status updates to IT Management and stakeholders including timelines and upcoming activities Provides input to IT Management in setting priorities and the order of the work to be done Required: Bachelors Degree or equivalent experience 7+ years’ experience in business analysis Expert with SQL and SQL Queries Knowledge of SDLC and how it pertains to software releases Experience in direct support of business organizations Analytic and logical thinking · Strong interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills Must work well in a team environment Must be able to learn independently Knowledge of flow charts including both business and system flows and of programming logic and code MS Office and knowledge of diagraming tools including Visio, Gliffy, and Balsamiq Strong understanding of the following Gap Analysis Difference between functional and Technical Waterfall and Agile methodologies Swim Lane Diagram Benefits All full time team members are eligible for a benefits package that is designed to offer convenience and security to our team members and their families. Programs, resources and benefit eligibility varies based on employment status, average hours worked, location and length of service. For detailed benefits info, please click here or type http://bit.ly/ORLYBenefits in your browser. This job is eligible for an annual cash bonus based on individual goal achievement.

The Product Technician will provide assistance with line and SKU maintenance. They will be responsible for loading and processing system SKU changes from suppliers and Product Managers. The Product Technician will provide support to various teams regarding inventory system maintenance questions. jobTitle: Remote Full Stack Software Engineer (Front End + Java)
jobDescription: A Full Stack Software Engineer at O'Reilly Auto Parts develops and supports both front-end and back-end applications for internal systems including Sales, Real Estate and Store Operations. This position creates functional mocks and develops front-end code in Vue and JavaScript while designing and integrating various software systems, databases, and third-party packages utilizing tools and technologies including Java, Spring, Hibernate, and SQL. What You'll Do Partner with key stakeholders to develop new applications and enhance and support existing applications and programs. Work with business systems analysts and stakeholders to translate business to technical requirements and solve problems. Collaborate with project teams and cross functional teams to troubleshoot open issues and bug-fixes. Collaborate, coach and mentor team members on best practices, code reviews, internal tools, and process improvements. Write and maintain readable, sustainable, and efficient code in highly optimized and scalable architectures. Own applications from conception and design, to implementation and support. Debug and test code as needed . Create and update advanced technical documentation.Skills and Qualifications Required High School diploma or equivalent. 4+ years of software development experience. Strong knowledge of software engineering best practices of the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control, testing, build and release engineering processes with focus on automation and end to end traceability. Web development skills including Java, HTML, CSS and experience using a modern reactive JavaScript library/framework such as Vue or React. Working understanding of databases including writing and amending queries in PostgreSQL, DB2, or other relational databases. Experience working in DevOps including continuous integration and continuous deployment using open source technologies like GIT, Jenkins, JIRA and Confluence. Experience in effectively communicating with a broad base of end users and multiple management layers, including the ability to interact with vendors as needed.Desired: Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent experience. Ability to articulate advanced technical concepts and teach others. Experience working in a remote, virtual or work-from-home environment. Location: Remote, USA - This role can be remote, virtual or work-from-home anywhere in the United States. Additional Locations: Austin, TX, Seattle, WA, Chicago, IL, Boston, MA, Houston, TX, Dallas, TX, Atlanta, GA, Colorado Springs, CO, Raleigh, NC, Tampa, FL, Huntsville, AL, Columbus, OH, Durham, NC, Jacksonville, FL, Baltimore, MD, Springfield, MO, St Louis, MO, Kansas City, MO, Bentonville, AR, Oklahoma City, OK, Minneapolis, MN About Us O'Reilly Auto Parts IT department provides services to our corporate office, 5,900+ stores, 29 distribution centers and 80,000+ team members. We have over 800 IT team members supporting 250+ small, medium and large web and software applications in addition to third party packages. We provide a collaborative environment and encourage knowledge sharing. We respect a healthy work-life balance and offer remote, virtual or work-from-home opportunities. Our teams keep open communication through video conferencing, team messaging and daily stand-ups. Our leadership values collaboration and encourages team members to bring creative problem-solving ideas from both a technical and functional perspective. We have several career paths, whether you want to be an individual contributor, manager, project manager, or stay technical - there's a documented growth plan to help you follow the path you choose. We want to grow our people - we help to make you better by providing training for both technical and professional development. A Senior Informatica Data Engineer works with various Information Technology and business partners to acquire, transform, deliver, and monitor data and data pipelines for the purpose of data quality, data analytics, and data management in support of enterprise data strategy. Essential Job Functions Support data acquisition, storage, transformation, analysis, and visualization projects as needed, including data modeling, data movement, data cleansing, and other data analysis techniques to collect, explore, and extract insights from data sets. Work with business owners and data analysts across the organization to understand requirements and develop technical specifications. Participate in developing a data governance framework to ensure integrity, reliability, and security of data. Provide ongoing training for data analysts and staff on development and use of relevant technology. Conduct validation and testing of reports, dashboards, and analytics to ensure consistent and accurate reporting across the organization. Provide recommendations to streamline and improve current business processes. Research emerging tools and applications that are applicable for the functional needs. Recommend and develop technical and automated solutions for manual processes. Suggest and implement team procedures and standards related to reporting and ad-hoc analysis to improve data accuracy, visibility, and value. Respond and fulfill data requests as required. Support ongoing reporting processes and upgrades. Communicate status to Business Analysts, Project Managers, and Management. Other Job Functions Stay current with industry trends and best practices in reporting and analytics. Other duties as assigned. Required Skills and Qualifications Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience. 6+ years of experience with key technology (e.g., data acquisition, data movement, data warehouse, data analytics, data visualization). Hands-on experience with developing and deploying reports & dashboards. Hands-on experience in creating and managing data flows. Strong analytical, quantitative and problem solving skills. Mastery of creating SQL queries to access complex data sources. Advanced level of proficiency with Microsoft Excel. Detail oriented with excellent organizational skills. Ability to identify opportunities for improvement. Self-motivated and able to multi-task, coordinate and prioritize concurrent tasks. Ability to successfully function in a high-pressure, fast-paced environment. Strong verbal and written communication and presentation skills. Ability to present complex information in an understandable and compelling manner. Ideal candidate will possess a passion for business intelligence, analytics and visual design concepts. Desired Experience with Informatica. Experience with data visualization tools (Salesforce Einstein Analytics, MicroStrategy, DOMO). Knowledge of data mining and advanced reporting techniques. Experience with statistics and predictive analysis. Experience with master data management and data governance. General Summary Under minimal supervision, a Sr. QA Engineer works to ensure that established standards are followed during the creation of automated test cases/scripts. They strive to continually enhance these standards so that all test assets are as reliable and maintainable as possible. A Sr. QA Engineer also troubleshoots issues that occur with the automation framework and takes ownership of them to see that they get resolved in a timely manner. In addition, they review the automated test cases/scripts of QA Developers and determine when they are ready for inclusion in the automated test library. Essential Job Functions May train and mentor QA Developers Review test assets and move them into the automated test library when appropriate Enhance the standards for test asset creation as required Troubleshoot issues involving the automation framework Review functional specifications, business requirements, and use cases Design and implement automated test cases/scripts using O'Reilly's defined framework Execute automated test cases/scripts to confirm a given application's functional requirements Identify and document application defects in a centralized issue tracking system Maintain detailed documentation of test results Enforce defect management procedures within the project team Provide assessment of product quality at key milestones to project stakeholder Use quantitative estimating techniques based on existing metrics and personal experience Other Job Functions SKILLS / EDUCATION / KNOWLEDGE / EXPERIENCE / ABILITIES Required 4+ years of automated quality assurance testing experience Ability to lead and manage others Working knowledge of software applications and testing best practices Exceptional problem-solving skills Precise attention to detail Must be able to learn independently Outstanding organizational skills Excellent verbal and written communication skills Must work well in a team environment Proven background with both manual and automated testing Desired Bachelor's degree in computer-related technical discipline Knowledge of SQL Experience with Windows PowerShell Programming experience (C# preferred) Experience with iSeries Knowledge of Windows Batch scripting Benefits All full time team members are eligible for a benefits package that is designed to offer convenience and security to our team members and their families. Programs, resources and benefit eligibility varies based on employment status, average hours worked, location and length of service. For detailed benefits info, please click here or type http://bit.ly/ORLYBenefits in your browser. A UI/UX Architect gives input for a web site's user interface and user experience. O'Reilly is now hiring Retail Counter Sales team members. Our sales team members are responsible for providing our retail and installer customers with a high level of service. They also support management in the accomplishment of all assigned tasks, including maintaining inventory control, store appearance, and customer relations. Essential Job Functions Greet and advise customers in selection of products and their uses Process customer returns and resolve customer complaints Assist with inventory and processing of incoming stock Perform value added services, i.e., test batteries, carry merchandise to customer cars, install wipers, etc. Handle cash and credit card transactions while properly maintaining a cash drawer Qualifications Ability to provide outstanding, friendly, and professional customer service Ability to quickly match alphanumeric sequences Must be able to multitask Familiarity with automotive parts, cataloging, and automotive sales or service is desired but not required ASE certification preferred O'Reilly takes pride in our company culture, so team members should also hold our culture values as true to their own. O'Reilly values are centered on Commitment, Dedication, Teamwork, Safety/Wellness, Enthusiasm, Expense Control, Honesty, Professionalism, Respect, Hard Work, and a Win-Win Attitude. Above all is Excellent Customer Service, which is the core of O'Reilly and the most important responsibility of our team members. Benefits All full time team members are eligible for a benefits package that is designed to offer convenience and security to our team members and their families. Programs, resources and benefit eligibility varies based on employment status, average hours worked, location and length of service. For detailed benefits info, please click here or type http://bit.ly/ORLYBenefits in your browser.

The Retail Facilities Operations Admin will assist with vendor maintenance, invoice processing, and vendor payment inquiries. Review vendor packets to ensure all needed documents are obtained and file accordingly. Review invoices to ensure all required criteria are present. Collaborate with the Maintenance Coordinators, outside vendors, Accounts Payable and the Finance Department to assure timely payment is processed. Essential Job Functions Maintains the departments vendor invoice email account: receiving, sending to appropriate team member for approval, timely response to vendor invoice payment inquiries. Maintains the departments new/potential vendor email account: receiving completed vendor packets, reviewing packet for all needed documentation, sending to appropriate team member for final review, set up new vendor in MARS. Maintaining vendor COI compliance and requirements. Review and process invoices to verify amounts, store numbers, and all necessary paperwork have been provided according to Retail Facilities invoicing requirements. Appropriately code all Retail Facilities Maintenance Coordinator approved invoices into the MARS system, and send on to the Accounts Payable/Finance Department for payment processing. Scan and upload invoices as well as related photos to the appropriate drive for future reference. Skills And Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent. Experience with MS Office. Excellent communication skills both verbal and written. Ability to handle multiple priorities and adapt to change. A Senior Java Application Developer at O'Reilly Auto Parts develops and supports applications for internal and external systems including Inventory, Supply Chain, eCommerce, Retail Applications, Enterprise Search and more. Our teams are focused on the development, design and integration of various software systems, databases, and third-party packages utilizing tools and technologies including Java, JavaFX, JavaScript, Spring, Hibernate, SOLR, and SQL. Essential Job Functions Partner with key stakeholders to develop new features and enhance and support existing applications and programs. Work with business systems analysts and stakeholders to translate business to technical requirements and problem solve. Collaborate with project teams and cross functional teams to troubleshoot open issues and bug-fixes. Collaborate, coach and mentor team members on best practices, code reviews, internal tools, and process improvements. Write and maintain readable, sustainable, and efficient code in highly optimized and scalable architectures. Own applications from conception and design, to implementation and support. Debug and test code as needed. Create and update advanced technical documentation. Skills and Qualifications Required: High School diploma or equivalent. 3+ years of software development experience. Strong knowledge of software engineering best practices of the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control, testing, build and release engineering processes with focus on automation and end to end traceability. Web development skills including JavaScript, HTML, CSS. Working understanding of databases including writing and amending queries in Oracle, SQL, PostgreSQL and/or NoSQL. Experience working in DevOps including continuous integration and continuous deployment using open source technologies like GIT, Jenkins, JIRA and Confluence. Experience in effectively communicating with a broad base of end users and multiple management layers, including the ability to interact with vendors as needed. Ability to work flexible schedule including nights/weekends. Desired: Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent experience. Ability to articulate advanced technical concepts and teach others. Experience working with Agile/Scrum methodology. Benefits All full time team members are eligible for a benefits package that is designed to offer convenience and security to our team members and their families. Programs, resources and benefit eligibility varies based on employment status, average hours worked, location and length of service.
