Description The Senior Technical Recruiter is responsible for managing the recruitment efforts for mid- and senior-level information technology (IT) positions. In partnership with IT and HR leaders, this role is responsible for developing strategies to attract and hire positions in software development, infrastructure, data, project management, quality assurance and leadership positions. The recruiting team is responsible for full-lifecycle recruiting including leading intake meetings, developing job postings, sourcing, interviewing, assessing, and hiring technical candidates. The senior technical recruiter partners with all levels of leadership to gather a strong understanding of the IT structure and how it supports the systems and applications that are used by the business daily. Essential Job Functions Own full recruitment life cycle for mid-, senior- and leadership-level technical positions including but not limited to application development, infrastructure, program management, data, quality assurance, and security positions. Lead kickoff meetings, understand and define applicant profile, determine sourcing strategy, apply process & define roles across interview teams, review target hire date, develop setback schedule and agree on calibration cadence. Utilize creative recruiting strategies to attract both passive and active candidates through social media, networking, niche job boards, and employee referrals. Responsible for sourcing active and passive candidates, completing initial screening, administering technical assessments, conducting HR technical interviews, qualifying and submitting candidates profiles, scheduling department interviews, gathering feedback, generating offer letters, extending verbal offers and onboarding new hires. Evaluate candidates' employment history, educational background, technical acumen and salary requirements in order to best match their skills with current job openings and budgets. Lead weekly/biweekly calibration discussion with hiring managers including advance sharing of candidate activity. Collaborate with HR Partners and hiring managers to develop offer recommendations which are competitive, compelling and aligned with O'Reilly compensation philosophy. Organize and redesign recruitment processes (candidate sourcing, resume screening, networking & interviewing techniques). Write, edit, maintain and update all job posts. Collaborate in strategic planning and initiatives on engaging and retaining IT team members while influencing recruiting methods and strategies. Collect and report recruitment efficiency metrics to drive increased performance in the talent acquisition process and analyze effectiveness. Skills And Qualifications BA/BS Degree and 3+ years of IT recruiting experience (or in lieu of degree, 5+ years of IT recruiting experience). 3+ years of experience managing 15+ requisitions of mid to senior level technical roles through the full lifecycle recruiting process. 1+ years of corporate recruiting experience. 2+ years of experience working in a remote/virtual environment. Experience with progressive sourcing techniques including direct sourcing and internet data mining and recruiting techniques such search engines, Boolean search strings, LinkedIn and other online networking communities. Benefits All full time team members are eligible for a benefits package that is designed to offer convenience and security to our team members and their families. Programs, resources and benefit eligibility varies based on employment status, average hours worked, location and length of service. For detailed benefits info, please click here or type http://bit.ly/ORLYBenefits in your browser.

A Software Architect guides the technical design and direction of enterprise-level mobile applications. Our Software Architects have advanced technical knowledge in Android and iOS development, web services, digital transformation, and service-base architecture. They are experts on existing software architecture design and inter-connectivity with upstream and downstream systems. Our teams are focused on the mobile architecture, development, design, and integration of various software systems, databases, and third-party packages utilizing tools and technologies including Java, Swift, and Kotlin. Essential Job Functions Works with lead business systems analysts, development teams, project managers and others to design and create, dependable, scalable, and maintainable systems. Develops standards and technical documentation for existing design of software systems. Takes lead role on designing and approving designs of new software or software integrations with 3rd parties. Participates in the discussion surrounding the long-term technical direction of the department. Works with software engineers and management to help shape coding standards and software development life cycle best practices. Manage tasks and resources while utilizing modern project management principles. Perform software and data analysis to uncover issues and solve complicated problems that typically span multiple systems. Conduct software demo's to educate and train others in the use of software. Skills/Qualifications Required: Deep understanding of the Android operating systems and Android Studio Experience with Google Firebase and related Google products Understands how to establish the value and cost of an IT project. Advanced understanding of change management control process and procedures. Strong knowledge of software engineering best practices of the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control, testing, and build and release engineering. Understanding of mobile, traditional web, and REST services, writing and managing API gateways, and service orchestration. Working understanding of databases including writing and amending queries in SQL, PostgreSQL and/or NoSQL. Experience working in DevOps including continuous integration and continuous deployment using technologies like Git, Jenkins, Postman, Bitbucket, Jira and Confluence. Experience in effectively communicating complex technical concepts with a broad base of end users and multiple management layers, including the ability to interact with vendors as needed. Desired: A bachelor's of science in a technology related field. Experience working with Agile/Scrum methodology. iOS development utilizing Swift. Familiarity with Dagger, RxJava, and Retrofit. Familiarity with various architecture types such as MVC, MVP, MVVM, DI, and IoC. Experience with MDM (Mobile Device Management) platforms. Experience working in a remote, virtual or work-from-home environment.

A Software Architect guides the technical design and direction of enterprise-level software solutions. Software architects are required to have advanced technical knowledge in all areas of software development, analysis, and design. Complete understanding of the department and or system(s) they are responsible for, as well as the overall business process of O'Reilly Auto Parts. Advanced knowledge of Project Development Life Cycle (PDLC) and Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC). Ability to lead and get results from others. Ability to articulate advanced technical concepts and teach others. Ability to effectively multitask. Expert software debugging and testing knowledge. Expert knowledge of complex computer systems (multiple programs, databases, communications etc). Expert knowledge of programming, database systems, and systems analysis and design. Ability to write advanced technical documentation. Exceptional problem-solving skills. Good verbal and written communications skills. Must work well in a team environment. Ability to learn independently. Willingness to work flexible schedule including nights/weekends. High School diploma or equivalent. The O'Reilly Auto Parts Software Developer Internship is an ongoing internship that begins with a 12 week classroom period to train each intern for a long term engagement with the company. This training period is taught by internship supervisors from O'Reilly Auto Parts and is hosted at Missouri State University. The program consists of both classroom training and hands-on experience in a lab environment. This internship requires part-time on site participation in Springfield, Missouri, Monday through Friday from 1PM to 5PM. The Spring Session will start Monday, January 30th through Friday April 21st, 2023. After the initial 12 week training period, interns transition to more flexible part time hours with an assigned development team. This internship is designed to be an ongoing opportunity for professional development as long-term team members of O'Reilly Auto Parts. A Software Engineer is a highly skilled software developer with expert knowledge in at least one department or system. They work with a high degree of independence and develop information systems to support the business. Engineers are primarily focused on the design or integration of various software systems, databases, and third-party packages. Essential Job Functions Generally takes leadership role in guiding projects through the complete software development life cycle. Typical focus is on code design efforts. Solid understanding of secure coding techniques and best practices. Responsible (takes ownership) for multiple software applications. Manage tasks and resources while utilizing modern project management principles. Participate or lead the development of multiple projects at one time. Conducts code reviews and ensures coding best practices are being followed. Recommend software improvements and changes to systems, as needed. May approve software to be deployed to production systems. Perform software and data analysis to uncover issues and solve complicated problems that typically span multiple systems. Lead various meetings to gather software requirements and project details. Conduct software demo's to educate and train others in the use of software. Debug and correct complex software defects. Develop new or modify existing software using coding best practices. Create or update advanced project documentation. Test software to validate accuracy of code and high quality software systems. Skills And Qualifications 4+ years of software development experience. Advanced understanding of change management and the O'Reilly change control process and procedures. Advanced knowledge of Project Development Life Cycle (PDLC) and Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC). Advanced understanding of the software and system(s) supported by their team, as well as the overall company business. Ability to lead and get results from others. Ability to articulate advanced technical concepts and teach others. Ability to effectively multitask. Expert software debugging and testing knowledge. Advanced understanding of complex computer systems (multiple programs, databases, communications etc). Advanced knowledge of programming, database systems, and systems analysis and design. Ability to write advanced technical documentation. Advanced problem-solving skills. Good verbal and written communications skills. Must work well in a team environment. Ability to learn independently. Experience with SEO best practices. Willingness to work flexible schedule including nights/weekends. High School diploma or equivalent. The Special Order Clerk will process store requests for special order items and follow up on special orders that were placed with factories.  Essential Job Functions Answer phone calls from store and factories. Process special order part requests by calling factories or researching websites. Research and quote pricing for parts, freight and services changes.  Relay order information to the store via phone or email. Track orders that have been placed and follow up with factories on orders not received, relaying this information to the stores. Audit factory invoices to ensure accuracy. Basic computer skills, including Microsoft Word, Excel, internet, and 10-key. Ability to work well in a team environment. This is a full-time opportunity; Monday-Friday, 9 a.m.-6 p.m.

Responsible for calling on assigned and new Professional Customer Accounts. Objectives are to work with assigned store managers and show consistent professional account sales growth through the sales of company products and professional program offerings. Projects proper O'Reilly image and follows policies and procedures to ensure their territory is operating as economically and efficiently as possible. Essential Job Functions PROFESSIONAL CUSTOMERS - Maintain customer base and increase sales volume on assigned accounts. Average number of assigned accounts is based off market entitlement in TSM territory. Average 18 - 22 calls per day. CURRENT AND NEW ACCOUNTS - Manage accounts as needed to best serve the professional customer and maintain up-to-date records for each account. Grow business by remaining competitive and maximizing the profit opportunity for that particular market. Pursue new, prospective accounts with the goal of two to five weekly (unassigned) cold calls. PROFESSIONAL MARKETING PROGRAMS - Aggressively promote and provide applicable training (as required) on all company programs which build relationships between the store and their professional and potential customers: Mitchell1, FirstCall OnLine, CAR, Stocking Inventories, Consignments, Tool and Equipment, RWT Clinics, National Accounts, Niche Markets, Integrated Auto Parts, Paint, Body and Equipment, etc. SCHEDULING - Ensure assigned accounts are designated with a set call schedule in the Sales Call Management Tool. Post current schedule at each assigned store location and discuss plans and action items with the store manager prior to calling on each days scheduled customer. The TSM Job is a full-time commission/base position that may require more than eight hours per day starting at 7:30 - 7:45 a.m. and returning to store no sooner than 4:30 p.m. to input call details through the Sales Call Management Tool. Overnight travel is required on an as needed basis. CUSTOMER SERVICE - Provide, address and support any and all customer service issues which deter business growth and in accordance with company policy. Work with RFSM, DM and SM to build a team support system that maintains excellent customer service. CREDIT AND COLLECTIONS - Work with credit and store managers to correct problems in collection efforts with Professional Customers, in accordance with company policies. LABOR CLAIMS - Serve as a Liaison between stores and Professional Customers on labor claims and other sensitive issues, in accordance with company policies. TEAM WEEKLY, NEWSLETTER AND TO DO ASSIGNMENTS - Ensure all information conveyed in weekly TeamNet communication systems or RFSM/TSM Conference Calls is utilized in the field to enhance business and field compliance for corporate directed requests. COMMUNICATIONS - Prompt communication via the daily Sales Call Management Tool, e-mail, To Do Assignments, etc., is essential to efficient company operation. LMS TRAINING - Responsible for completing all assigned and extra credit LMS to maximize field skills to support Professional Customer growth, remain compliant on company policies and procedures and minimize accidents and related expenses. REPORTING - Responsible for reviewing or providing information for all related reports that support operation and function of the territory. Remain alert for competitive situations and keep management informed. MEETINGS, CONFERENCE CALLS AND EVENTS - Mandatory attendance is required for all schedules calls and meetings as directed. Communication and instructions conveyed during these meetings are vital so field supervisors may address or research your questions whenever possible. Actively participate in trade shows and training classes as scheduled. APPEARANCE - TSMs are required to maintain a professional image as they represent the company in the field. Proper shirt attire is required through the Field Apparel Program and allowance system. DRIVING REQUIREMENTS - The TSM position requires extensive driving on a daily basis, which requires a valid driver's license according to the Employment Driving Policy and Guidelines #113. Qualifications High school diploma or equivalent. Working knowledge of auto repair, parts, equipment and systems. Strong verbal communication skills. Good written communication skills. Positive interaction with people. Must be organized and able to set priorities and manage time in territory. TSM Development Program module. Bilingual - Spanish is required. Benefits All full time team members are eligible for a benefits package that is designed to offer convenience and security to our team members and their families. Programs, resources and benefit eligibility varies based on employment status, average hours worked, location and length of service. For detailed benefits info, please click here or type http://bit.ly/ORLYBenefits in your browser.

jobTitle: Warehouse HR Specialist with $4,000 Sign On Bonus
jobDescription: O'Reilly Auto Parts is now hiring a Warehouse HR Specialist who has a knack for customer service and believes in the power of teamwork! As a Warehouse HR Specialist you will be a pillar of support to the Human Resources team, as well as the warehouse team members. Our ideal candidate is self motivated and eager to learn and not afraid to navigate through ambiguity. What We Offer $4,000 Sign On Bonus 6 paid holidays Flexible Medical/Dental/Vision Plans, starting within 30 days 401K plan with employer contributions Opportunity for advancement and career development Bi-Weekly pay schedule What You Will Do Provide support to the HR team by tracking emergency contacts information, team member listings, turnover reports, and other reports for Warehouse team members Order, distribute, and process billing information for uniform shirts for DC team members and supervisors Generate and prepare monthly evaluations for all Warehouse team members on their scheduled date and distribute to supervisors to assure all evaluations are completed in a timely manner Schedule interviews, prescreen applicants, track drug screens, and make reference checks for future team members for the Warehouse HR Business Partner Partner with Warehouse HR Business Partner to process new hire paperwork, create team member badges and orientation materials Provide support to team members as needed including getting benefit information, uniform information, or any other personal assistance as needed Attend and write meeting minutes for the Morale Team meetings and distribute to committee members, supervisors, and Warehouse FYI newsletter Copy and distribute phone lists for supervisors, corporate and store information listings, employee evacuation lists, and various other documents Coordinate team member activities and team member goodwill projects for the Warehouse Partner with Warehouse HR Business Partner to process workman's compensation paperwork and team member follow-up Assure proper phone coverage at all times for the human resources office, and provide telephone coverage for Warehouse HR Business Partner and Warehouse Manager What You Will Need Bilingual Preferred** Proficient in ten-key, data entry, and mid-range computer systems Excellent written and verbal communication skills Ability to handle multiple tasks accurately and with minimal supervision Proficient in PC basic programs for word processing and spreadsheets Must be able to work closely and well with others in a team environment Benefits All full time team members are eligible for a benefits package that is designed to offer convenience and security to our team members and their families. Programs, resources and benefit eligibility varies based on employment status, average hours worked, location and length of service. For detailed benefits info, please click here or type http://bit.ly/ORLYBenefits in your browser.

This position will need to be relocatable. Our Warehouse Manager in Training program allows qualified individuals the opportunity to train, lead, mentor, and work with an existing Warehouse Manager on how to effectively and efficiently operate our modern warehouse. One the program is completed, our Warehouse Manager in Training candidates will successfully understand how to manage and operate a warehouse! By accepting a position as a Warehouse Manager in Training, you will be gaining the highest levels of logistics support knowledge while developing, mentoring, engaging, and retaining team members. Through our commitment to our team members and to our customers, we have grown into a diverse team that lives the O'Reilly culture daily. Our group of strong leaders provide the training and support needed to take you beyond the warehouse and into your career. Qualifications Able to relocate to any of our Warehouse locations across the nation Above average computer skills. Demonstrated ability to manage multi-task operations High school diploma or equivalent required Excellent communication, leadership, and people skills Four years or more of successful management or assistant management in a warehouse is desired Bachelor's degree or logistics certification desired, but not required Benefits Offered Medical/Dental/Vision Plans, starting within 30 days 401K plan with employer contributions Paid vacation, holiday and sick time Flexible Spending Account O'Reilly takes pride in our company culture, so team members should also hold our culture values as true to their own. O'Reilly values are centered on Commitment, Dedication, Teamwork, Safety/Wellness, Enthusiasm, Expense Control, Honesty, Professionalism, Respect, Hard Work, and a Win-Win Attitude. Above all is Excellent Customer Service, which is the core of O'Reilly and the most important responsibility of our team members. Candidates must be at least 18 years of age and able to pass a drug test and/or MVR check, as applicable for the role. Benefits All full time team members are eligible for a benefits package that is designed to offer convenience and security to our team members and their families. Programs, resources and benefit eligibility varies based on employment status, average hours worked, location and length of service. O'Reilly is now hiring a dedicated and hardworking Warehouse Operations Manager. This team member will support the warehouse manager by driving the daily operations of the warehouse and its team members and is responsible for leading the operations team and monitoring accuracy, productivity, and safety throughout the warehouse. The Operations Manager will partner with the warehouse manager to resolve all warehouse related issues by proactively providing feedback and facilitating training when needed. This team member will be responsible for determining the efficiency of operations, and for identifying areas of improvement. By accepting a position as a Warehouse Operations Manager, you will be gaining the knowledge and expertise of the industry. Through our commitment to our team members and to our customers, we have grown into a diverse team that lives the O'Reilly culture daily. Our group of strong leaders provide the training and support needed to take you beyond the warehouse and into your career. Essential Job Functions Able to relocate to any of our Warehouse locations across the nation Provide support to the warehouse manager in all aspects of operations, including service, physical assets, operating costs, and team member relations Partner with warehouse leadership to maintain payroll, budgeting, inventory integrity, and productivity Provide the training, guidance, and counseling necessary for individual team members Provide excellent leadership throughout all departments and ensure productivity and morale are maintained at a high level Provide a safe working environment and manage all risks and risk related costs Qualifications 4+ years warehouse supervisor experience with proven record of success Excellent leadership skills Ability to work closely with others in a team environment Ability to manage multiple departments within a warehouse Thrive in a busy, fast-paced warehouse environment Take pride in delivering excellent customer service Available to work a flexible schedule High school diploma or equivalent Benefits Offered Medical/Dental/Vision Plans, starting within 30 days 401K plan with employer contributions Paid vacation, holiday and sick time Flexible Spending Account Team Member Discount O'Reilly takes pride in our company culture, so team members should also hold our culture values as true to their own. O'Reilly values are centered on Commitment, Dedication, Teamwork, Safety/Wellness, Enthusiasm, Expense Control, Honesty, Professionalism, Respect, Hard Work, and a Win-Win Attitude. Above all is Excellent Customer Service, which is the core of O'Reilly and the most important responsibility of our team members. To see all our Warehouse Operations Manager opportunities at all of our warehouses, please visit http://bit.ly/OReillyOpsCareers Candidates must be 18 years of age or older, able to pass a background check, drug test and/or MVR check, as applicable for the role Benefits All full time team members are eligible for a benefits package that is designed to offer convenience and security to our team members and their families. Description As a Web Analytics Manager you will lead the team focused on analytics reporting and operations for the Omnichannel & Marketing departments. This role is in charge of executing the reporting & analytics strategy, team development, establishing best-practices, and providing key insights to stakeholders. Reports and projects will focus on sales forecasting, Ecommerce operations & fulfillment, and analysis for related marketing activities associated with driving site traffic, customer engagement, and conversion. What You'll Do Maintain staffing and leadership of direct team members to include coaching, goal setting and evaluations. Drive initiatives and processes for compiling, organizing and reconciling data for omnichannel and marketing teams. Provide insights, analysis, and recommendations for fulfillment processes and opportunities for efficiencies with online ordering processes. Work cross-functionally with other departments to build holistic reports on our Omnichannel performance & customer journeys. What You Bring To The Table Ability to lead and develop a successful team. Strong skills in creating tags for tracking, extracting data, and building comprehensive reports and dashboards. Excellent analytical skills with demonstrated experience turning data into actionable insights. Inquisitive and in constant pursuit of innovative ways to drive results; does not settle for the status quo. Who We Are Our company is built on the foundation of the O'Reilly culture. Our business ethics make up our company culture, and it is our way of life! Wellness on campus clinic; 24/7 gym and locker rooms Expense Control education assistance, team member discounts; perks Teamwork Supportive, collaborative; tenured team Benefits All full time team members are eligible for a benefits package that is designed to offer convenience and security to our team members and their families. The Workers Compensation Coordinator is responsible for the overall management of team member injury claims, to ensure that injured team members receive the benefits that they deserve, while minimizing corporate claim costs. Essential Job Functions Assess all new claims and immediately engage in those that are serious, questionable, or lost-time. Act as "Injury Counselors" and maintain regular contact with injured team members. Manage the work of the claim administrator to ensure compliance with special claim handling requirements as well as industry standards. Alert Manager of problems. Manage claim administrator's utilization of appropriate vendor service providers. Coordinate with doctors, claim administrator, field management, etc. in managing the application of the transitional modified duty program. Act as a liaison between team member, claim administrator and the Company to ensure all eligible benefits are provided to the injured team member. Skills And Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent. Excellent communication and negotiation skills. Two years of experience in managing and coordinating worker's compensation claims and/or experience in human resources. Understanding of claim management processes and procedures. Benefits All full time team members are eligible for a benefits package that is designed to offer convenience and security to our team members and their families. Programs, resources and benefit eligibility varies based on employment status, average hours worked, location and length of service. For detailed benefits info, please click here or type http://bit.ly/ORLYBenefits in your browser.
